title: How to Inflate an AeroBed

steps.headline: Open up the box that stores your product.
Release all the tape and labels that are attached to the product.
Lay the product down on the floor, but make sure the box that triggers the inflation is facing upwards, so you can see it.
Make sure there is still room to move safely around the bed, once it begins to inflate/rise.
steps.description: Also, make sure it has ample enough space it needs to use to set up, per its standard bed size.

steps.headline: Make sure the cord is unruffled from its knot and the tape that provides safety to the product's edges on the cord can't get in the way.
steps.description: You must be able to plug in the item to a wall outlet for a few minutes.

steps.headline: Walk down to the other end.
steps.description: You'll see a cover that covers an "Let out air" area. The "Whoosh" valve is a special valve that only AeroBeds have on all the products they produce.

steps.headline: Make sure to close/secure the Whoosh valve in place.
steps.description: IF you forget and it's open, you'll see that any air that enters the product will be extracted right back out of the product before any air gets let in.

steps.headline: Look at the box.
steps.description: Not only will you see a switch on it, but you'll also see an air exchange "valve" cover/opening on it. Not only does this air compressor inflate the bed, but it can also deflate the bed without help, and the air comes back out through this area in the compressor.

steps.headline: Flip the switch on the compressor to inflate.
steps.description: You'll hear the motor begin to run and you should see the bed begin to expand and rise from its lightest state ever.

steps.headline: Wait for the bed to completely inflate.
steps.description: The pump won't turn off, so, as it's coming close to finishing and the bed feels close to firm, keep an eye and turn it off every couple of seconds.

steps.headline: Turn the pump off once the bed is firm.
Look for the bag that contains your Aerobed.
steps.description: It may be in the official Aerobed bag that comes with all Aerobed products.

steps.headline: Lay the product down on the floor, but make sure the box that triggers the inflation is facing upwards, so you can see it.
Make sure there is still room to move safely around the bed, once it begins to inflate/rise.
steps.description: Also, make sure it has ample enough space it needs to use to set up, per its standard bed size.

steps.headline: Make sure the cord is unruffled from its knot and the tape that provides safety to the product's edges on the cord can't get in the way.
steps.description: You must be able to plug in the item to a wall outlet for a few minutes.

steps.headline: Walk down to the other end.
steps.description: You'll see a cover that covers an "Let out air" area. The "Whoosh" valve is a special valve that only AeroBed has on all the products they produce.

steps.headline: Make sure to close/secure the Whoosh valve.
steps.description: IF you forget and it's open, you'll see that any air that enters the product will be extracted right back out of the product before any air gets let in.

steps.headline: Look at the box.
steps.description: Not only will you see a switch on it, but you'll also see an air exchange "valve" cover/opening on it. Not only does this air compressor inflate the bed, but it can also deflate the bed without help, and the air comes back out through this area in the compressor.

steps.headline: Flip the switch on the compressor to inflate.
steps.description: You'll hear the motor begin to run and you should see the bed begin to expand and rise from its lightest state ever.

steps.headline: Wait for the bed to completely inflate.
steps.description: The pump won't turn off, so, as it's coming close to finishing and the bed feels close to firm, keep an eye and turn it off every couple of seconds.

steps.headline: Turn the pump off once the bed is firm.
Look for the bag or box that contains your Aerobed.
steps.description: It may be in the official Aerobed bag that comes with all Aerobed products.

steps.headline: Lay the product down on the floor, but make sure the box that triggers the inflation is facing upwards, so you can see it.
Make sure there is still room to move safely around the bed, once it begins to inflate/rise.
steps.description: Also, make sure it has ample enough space it needs to use to set up, per its standard bed size.

steps.headline: Make sure the cord is unruffled from its knot and the tape that provides safety to the product's edges on the cord can't get in the way.
steps.description: You must be able to plug in the item to a wall outlet for a few minutes.

steps.headline: Walk down to the other end.
steps.description: You'll see a cover that covers an "Let out air" area. The "Whoosh" valve is a special valve that only AeroBeds have on all the products they produce.

steps.headline: Make sure to close/secure the Whoosh valve in place.
steps.description: IF you forget and it's open, you'll see that any air that enters the product will be extracted right back out of the product before any air gets let in.

steps.headline: Look at the entry area to the product.
steps.description: These special Aerobeds might not be super-expensive and seem to be simple, but they also require a little more assistance from their user.

steps.headline: Hold the compressor up to the entry hole, as you turn on the switch to the compressor.
Be prepared to hold the compressor still over the hole, until the bed is firm.
Pull the compressor away from the bed once you've felt for the firmness of the bed.
Turn off the compressor and re-cap the entry hole.

text: For a New Bed Open up the box that stores your product.  Release all the tape and labels that are attached to the product.  Lay the product down on the floor, but make sure the box that triggers the inflation is facing upwards, so you can see it.  Make sure there is still room to move safely around the bed, once it begins to inflate/rise. Also, make sure it has ample enough space it needs to use to set up, per its standard bed size. Make sure the cord is unruffled from its knot and the tape that provides safety to the product's edges on the cord can't get in the way. You must be able to plug in the item to a wall outlet for a few minutes. Walk down to the other end. You'll see a cover that covers an "Let out air" area. The "Whoosh" valve is a special valve that only AeroBeds have on all the products they produce. Make sure to close/secure the Whoosh valve in place. IF you forget and it's open, you'll see that any air that enters the product will be extracted right back out of the product before any air gets let in. Look at the box. Not only will you see a switch on it, but you'll also see an air exchange "valve" cover/opening on it. Not only does this air compressor inflate the bed, but it can also deflate the bed without help, and the air comes back out through this area in the compressor. Flip the switch on the compressor to inflate. You'll hear the motor begin to run and you should see the bed begin to expand and rise from its lightest state ever. Wait for the bed to completely inflate. The pump won't turn off, so, as it's coming close to finishing and the bed feels close to firm, keep an eye and turn it off every couple of seconds. Turn the pump off once the bed is firm.  For a Previously Used Bed Look for the bag that contains your Aerobed. It may be in the official Aerobed bag that comes with all Aerobed products. Lay the product down on the floor, but make sure the box that triggers the inflation is facing upwards, so you can see it.  Make sure there is still room to move safely around the bed, once it begins to inflate/rise. Also, make sure it has ample enough space it needs to use to set up, per its standard bed size. Make sure the cord is unruffled from its knot and the tape that provides safety to the product's edges on the cord can't get in the way. You must be able to plug in the item to a wall outlet for a few minutes. Walk down to the other end. You'll see a cover that covers an "Let out air" area. The "Whoosh" valve is a special valve that only AeroBed has on all the products they produce. Make sure to close/secure the Whoosh valve. IF you forget and it's open, you'll see that any air that enters the product will be extracted right back out of the product before any air gets let in. Look at the box. Not only will you see a switch on it, but you'll also see an air exchange "valve" cover/opening on it. Not only does this air compressor inflate the bed, but it can also deflate the bed without help, and the air comes back out through this area in the compressor. Flip the switch on the compressor to inflate. You'll hear the motor begin to run and you should see the bed begin to expand and rise from its lightest state ever. Wait for the bed to completely inflate. The pump won't turn off, so, as it's coming close to finishing and the bed feels close to firm, keep an eye and turn it off every couple of seconds. Turn the pump off once the bed is firm.  Using a Hand-held Compressor Look for the bag or box that contains your Aerobed. It may be in the official Aerobed bag that comes with all Aerobed products. Lay the product down on the floor, but make sure the box that triggers the inflation is facing upwards, so you can see it.  Make sure there is still room to move safely around the bed, once it begins to inflate/rise. Also, make sure it has ample enough space it needs to use to set up, per its standard bed size. Make sure the cord is unruffled from its knot and the tape that provides safety to the product's edges on the cord can't get in the way. You must be able to plug in the item to a wall outlet for a few minutes. Walk down to the other end. You'll see a cover that covers an "Let out air" area. The "Whoosh" valve is a special valve that only AeroBeds have on all the products they produce. Make sure to close/secure the Whoosh valve in place. IF you forget and it's open, you'll see that any air that enters the product will be extracted right back out of the product before any air gets let in. Look at the entry area to the product. These special Aerobeds might not be super-expensive and seem to be simple, but they also require a little more assistance from their user. Hold the compressor up to the entry hole, as you turn on the switch to the compressor.  Be prepared to hold the compressor still over the hole, until the bed is firm.  Pull the compressor away from the bed once you've felt for the firmness of the bed.  Turn off the compressor and re-cap the entry hole.
